<title level="1" pfs="">[Agathion, Guloval](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2078)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Agathions are born from petitioners who achieved enlightenment in life or after death and received [Nirvana's](/Planes.aspx?ID=20) blessing. A guloval is small in stature but fierce, appearing as an anthropomorphic wolverine with gray and black fur, a white strip down the snout, and fearsome digging claws that can be easily used as weapons.

 A guloval's core value is aggressive protection, and as such, they are one of the most militant of the normally peaceful agathions. A guloval attacks with a frightening ferocity to protect others, and they particularly seek out roles as guardians of children or the elderly. Despite this compulsion to protect those who may not be able to defend themselves, gulovals are also known for grumpy temperaments and impatience with social niceties. Most prefer to live as hermits when they're not assisting someone in need.

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 12">[Guloval](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2078)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NG" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Small" />
<trait label="Agathion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=349" />
<trait label="Celestial" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=23" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #183: Field of Maidens](/Sources.aspx?ID=145) pg. 81</row>

**Perception** +23; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=293)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +25, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +21, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +23, [Nirvana Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +23

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +4

**Con** +5

**Int** +4

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +3
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 32 

**Fort** +22 

**Ref** +21 

**Will** +24 

+1 status bonus to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)
</row>

**HP** 250

**Weaknesses**
evil 10

**Interposition** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A ward within the guloval's reach would take damage from a Strike, and the guloval is within the attacker's reach; **Effect** The guloval blocks the attack with their own body, taking the triggering attack's damage. The ward takes no damage.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, burrow 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +25 ([Good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 3d8+13 piercing plus 1d6 good

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +25 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 3d4+13 slashing plus 1d6 good

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 32, attack +24
- **2nd**
[Shield Other](/Spells.aspx?ID=281)
- **3rd**
[Remove Disease](/Spells.aspx?ID=251)
- **4th**
[Circle of Protection](/Spells.aspx?ID=38), [Remove Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=250)
- **5th**
[Blink Charge](/Spells.aspx?ID=872), [Breath of Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=29)
- **6th**
[Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86), [Remove Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=252), [Righteous Might](/Spells.aspx?ID=263)
- **Constant (6th)**
[Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293)

**Righteous Wound**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) When a guloval critically hits an evil creature with any melee Strike, the evil creature becomes [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19). If that evil creature has damaged one of the guloval's wards within the last round, it's instead frightened 2.

**Shield Ward** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Abjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=2), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The guloval enhances the magical link with their ward, granting that creature a +1 status bonus to its Armor Class and saving throws until the start of the guloval's next turn.

**Wolverine's Protection** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Abjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=2), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The guloval selects a single willing ally within 30 feet as their ward; that ally can't already be the ward of another guloval. Once an ally becomes a ward, a magical link forms between the guloval and the ward, and as long as they are on the same plane and both are alive, the guloval knows the ward's direction from them, distance from them, and any conditions affecting them. A guloval can maintain this link with up to 4 wards—if they select a fifth, one of the previous wards (chosen by the guloval) loses the link and is no longer a ward.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Holoma Gulovals</title>

A few Holoma clans maintain close relationships with gulovals who have traveled far from their home in [Nirvana](/Planes.aspx?ID=20) to dwell on Golarion. These gulovals are truly ferocious when marching into battle alongside Holoma allies. All gulovals have internal codes that help guide and prevent them from harming innocents, and those allied with Holoma families are no exception.
</aside>
